etymology: Inherited from Ottoman Turkish اڭینه بوینه (eñine boyuna), from اڭ (eñ) and بوی (boy), equivalent to en (“width, breadth”) + -i (possessive suffix) + -(n)e (dative suffix with "n" as buffer consonant) + boy (“length, height”) + -u (possessive suffix) + -(n)a (dative suffix with "n" as buffer consonant), literally “widthwise and lengthwise”.
